item.title: Assassin's Creed Shadows Expansion Leak Details Over 10 Hours Of Gameplay
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/assassins-creed-shadows-expansion-leak-details-over-10-hours-of-gameplay/1100-6528742/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Details about an expansion for Assassin's Creed Shadows has leaked on the game's Steam page, which has now been scrubbed of this information.

According to Insider Gaming, the expansion is called Claws of Awaji and it features an additional 10 hours of gameplay. Players will be able to travel to a new location and unlock a new weapon type, as well as skills, gears, and abilities. Other that that, there's no other info regarding what the expansion's story is.

Assassin's Creed Shadows was originally planned for a release date of February 14, but was delayed once again to March 20. The decision was made in order to further improve its gameplay quality and performance.

Ubisoft is going through a tumultuous time right now, as it's currently trying to pursue "various transformational strategic and capitalistic options" to maximize shareholder value. Ubisoft is reportedly looking for a buyer, such as Tencent. Ubisoft also recently responded to a report about abuse at an Indonesian support studio that assisted with the game.

Players will be able to perform new parkour moves and a Naruto run with the female co-protagonist, Naoe. Assassin's Creed Shadows is also reportedly receiving a co-op mode called League, where Naoe and the other co-protagonist, Yasuke, could fight alongside each other.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: The First Berserker: Khazan Demo Launching Soon, Two Months Ahead Of Release
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/the-first-berserker-khazan-demo-launching-soon-two-months-ahead-of-release/1100-6528740/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Publisher Nexon has announced that The First Berserker: Khazan is getting a demo on January 16, and players will be able to spend as much time as they want in it.

The game's official Twitter account posted that the demo will go live on PC, PlayStation, and Xbox at 10 AM ET / 7 AM PT with "no end date scheduled." Presumably, this means that the demo will stay up for the foreseeable future for players to check out.

The First Berserker: Khazan is an action-RPG and the next entry in the Dungeon & Fighter series. It's set 800 years before the events of the series, and follows Khazan, who is falsely accused of treason and subsequently banished to the snowy mountains before going on a quest for vengeance. The game features Ben Starr, who voiced Final Fantasy XVI's main protagonist Clive Rosfield, as the voice of Khazan.

The developer is South Korean studio Neople, which is known for the multiplayer beat-'em-up game Dungeon Fighter Online.

In GameSpot's The First Berserker: Khazan beta preview, we said that it plays like a power fantasy version of Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice, "The beta saw a necessity to memorize the rhythms of boss and elite enemy attacks as players deflected their blows, all while managing a stamina gauge. There was simply no separating Khazan from Sekiro."

Dungeon The game was first announced at The Game Awards 2023, but got an extended trailer look at The Game Awards 2024. It's releasing on March 27 for PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S.

George Yang on Google+

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
